You'll need an X server for the editor since it's all GUI and shiny; [MobaXterm](http://mobaxterm.mobatek.net/) is a good one. --- _Comments from the [review on Reviewable.io](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/powershell/powershell/737#-:-KDZ_DYf24cy7ACAWFxP:1417088721)_

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body:
the last test can be made much simpler

```
It "should create a .Net object with using ArgumentList switch" {  
    $o = New-Object -TypeName System.Version -ArgumentList "1.2.3.4"  
    $o.GetType() | Should Be ([System.Version])
    "$o" | Should Be "1.2.3.4"
 }  
```

We needn't test that [System.Version] is public, IsSerializable, etc.
the last `$o | Should Be "1.2.3.4"` does make an assumption about the System.Version.ToString method, but that might be ok
